SQL_STMT_U.val: SELECT DH.DUNH_ID, DH.DUNH_DEBC_NO, DH.DUNH_DATE, DH.DUNH_ACTION, DH.DUNH_RECIPIENT, DH.DUNH_HYPA_ID, DH.DUNH_HYPA_DEPARTMENTNAME, DH.DUNH_REPA_JOURNALNO, 0 ARCH_DOCTYPE FROM :1/dunh dh left outer join :2/duld dd on dh.dunh_action=dd.duld_letter left outer join :3/hydt hy on dh.dunh_doctype=hy.HYDT_DOCTYPE WHERE DUNH_DEBC_NO=:4 AND DUNH_DATE>':5' AND ((DH.DUNH_REPA_JOURNALNO>0 AND DD.DULD_DISPLAYONDUNNINGHISORYWEB='Y') OR (DUNH_DOCTYPE > 0 and HYDT_DISPLAYINDUNNINGHISTWEB = 'Y') OR (DUNH_ACTION='TEL' and DUNH_REMARKPRESENT='Y' and (DUNH_RECIPIENT=1 or DUNH_RECIPIENT=2))) ORDER BY DUNH_DATE DESC

Text.val: view v_ica302B_actions returns a union. it selects all DUNH rows with:
'013' ,'018','TEL') AND DUNH_RECIPIENT IN (1, 2)
o DUNH_ACTION = 'TEL' AND H.DUNH_REMARKPRESENT='Y' AND
H.DUNH_RECIPIENT IN (1,2)
o DUNH_ACTION='DOC' AND
ARCH.ARCH_DOCTYPE IN (101, 105)
(check the views SELECTs for details)
This tasks then limits above selection to records with:
o DUNH_DEBC_NO = (DEBC_NO for parameter debtor id)
o DUNH_DATE > v.min_dunh_date
if dunh has a repa journal no, it is a letter for which we find the definition
in DULD. We then can check if its allowed tp display this in the web ....
if we did not output any action, we output an empty table to avoid html errors .
find out what kind of dunning action this is ....
can the user click the row ....
text (description) for the row ....
